etymology.description: 锅(锅/鍋: pot) + 盔(helmet) = pot-helmet flatbread.
etymology.interpretation: Name likens a pot-baked, round flatbread to a helmet in shape, reflecting baking on/against a pot or helmet in folk accounts. Some regions use the variant 锅魁/鍋魁 by folk etymology.
etymology.simplification: 鍋 → 锅: the metal radical 金 simplified to 钅 and the inner component reduced; 盔 unchanged (same in simplified and traditional).

examples.chinese: 我买了一个热乎乎的锅盔(我買了一個熱乎乎的鍋盔)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎile yí gè rèhūhu de guōkuī.
examples.english: I bought a piping-hot guokui flatbread.

examples.chinese: 陕西的锅盔又大又香(陝西的鍋盔又大又香)。
examples.pinyin: Shǎnxī de guōkuī yòu dà yòu xiāng.
examples.english: Shaanxi’s guokui are big and fragrant.

examples.chinese: 街口那家现烤锅盔最有名(街口那家現烤鍋盔最有名)。
examples.pinyin: Jiēkǒu nà jiā xiàn kǎo guōkuī zuì yǒumíng.
examples.english: The freshly baked guokui at the street-corner shop is the most famous.
